intro: Corunastylis ciliata, commonly known as the hairy mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and white, waxy flowers. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its hairy stems and clustered inflorescences. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid, shaded environments. Corunastylis ciliata relies on its host for water and nutrients, while still performing some photosynthesis.
